III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4123 Education
Section (2) Provision shall be made for an appropriate education program
Description in accordance with 1976 PA 451, MCL 380.1 to 380.1853. Each
resident of school age shall be enrolled not later than 5 school
days after admission and continuously thereafter.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth are not receiving adequate educational services. Teachers
don't show up, safety issues prevent teachers from showing up
and there are not enough teachers to serve all the children as
reasons for school related issues. IEPs are not being honored.
Several inquiries have been made by the local office regarding
school and the above responses were provided.
Investigation Foster Care Worker (FCW) was interviewed via telephone on
2/26/25. FCW reported that Youth A has a lot of behavioral issues,
has refused to attend classes, and when he attends, he gets in
trouble due to his behavior and instigating fights with other youths.
FCW said she requested an IEP for Youth A during a Family
Team Meeting with Case Manager on 11/25/2024. She has
requested updates from Case Manager regarding the IEP and
was informed that it has not been completed. She is not sure why
it is taking this long for the school to complete the IEP.
Director was interviewed at the facility on 02/27/2025. Director
reported she was informed last week that Case Manager had
requested an IEP for Youth A, and the school has started the
assessment process for the IEP. Director is not aware of any
safety issues that are preventing teachers from showing up to
classes or that classes are being cancelled because there are
not enough teachers. She said staff are present in the classroom
to provide support for the teachers and address any safety issues.
She is familiar with Youth A and reported Youth A has not been
consistent with attending school because he refuses to attend.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 02/27/2025. Youth A
has been at the facility for 8 months, he is placed on Pod 8, and
there are four youths on his pod. Youth A reported he started
attending school in August of 2024 at the facility. He reported he
does not attend school every day because he sometimes does not
feel like attending. He said school is offered Monday through
Friday from 9:00 am to 3:30 pm. He does not recall the day when
school was cancelled because there wasn’t a teacher present. He
said when he attends classes there is a teacher, assistant
2

teacher, and staff present in the classroom. Youth A admitted he
has been involved in several fights with other youths, but it does
not involve teachers. He is not aware of any incident regarding a
teacher being afraid to come to class. Youth A reported he feels
safe in the classroom and at the facility.
School Administrator was interviewed at the facility on
02/27/2025. School Administrator reported she is the principal of
Covenant School that provides the educational program for
Spectrum. She said the school is onsite and there is a classroom
for each pod. The classes are Monday through Friday from 9:00
am to 3:30 pm. She said there are a total of 30 educational staff
that includes teachers and teacher’s assistant. She said there is a
school social worker, school counselor, and occupational therapist
that are always on site. She said if a teacher calls off there are
other teachers that can cover the classes. She is not aware of
classes being cancelled due to teachers not showing up or being
afraid of the youths in the program. She said Youth A was enrolled
in the school in September of 2024, however Youth A does not
attend school consistently. She said Youth A has refused to attend
or participate in classes just because he does not feel like being in
class. She said Youth A’s case manager requested an IEP for him
in November 2024. She requested Case Manager to find out if
Youth A had a previous IEP and was informed Youth A did not
have an IEP. The process for an IEP is to get the parent/guardian
permission and start the testing process. They obtained
permission from Youth A’s grandfather, completed the Functional
Behavior Assessment and a Positive Behavioral Intervention. and
the Support Plan was completed. Youth A still needs to have a
psychological assessment and then they can proceed with
completing his IEP.
Case Manager was interviewed at the facility on 03/04/2025. The
Case Manager is not aware of any incidents where school was
cancelled, or teachers don’t show up because they are afraid of
the youths. Case Manager reported Foster Care Worker did
request an IEP for Youth A on 11/25/2024, and she informed the
school Principal, however the school asked if Youth A had a
previous IEP. She was going back and forth with the school and
Foster Care Worker because the school wanted to make sure
Youth A did not have a previous IEP. She said the school was not
providing updates on the IEP process and testing and that’s why
she did not provide Foster Care Worker with the requested
updates for the IEP. Case Manager said the youths do
sometimes get into fights in the classroom, but staff members are
present and they intervene and de-escalate the youths. Case
3

Manger reported she has been working with Youth A since he was
placed at the facility in June of 2024, Youth A has not been
consistent with attending school or participating in the classroom
and that also is the reason for the delay in completing the
assessments for his IEP.
Youth B and Youth C were interviewed separately at the facility
on 03/26/2025. Youth B and Youth C both reported they attend
school at the facility Monday through Friday, and that classes
have never been cancelled due to teachers not being present.
Youth B and Youth C said staff members are also present in the
classroom, and they reported no safety concerns regarding the
facility.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A School engagement report: Youth A was enrolled
in Covenant School and started attending classes on
09/06/2024.
• Functional Behavior Assessment for Youth A dated
01/10/2025. Summary Youth A needs continued social
work one on one and mental health support for him to gain
the necessary skills for him to learn.
• Positive Behavior Intervention and Support Plan dated
01/10/2025. Youth A is significantly functioning below grade
level.
• Email from the School Principal received on 04/17/2025-
Youth A REED (consent for evaluation meeting) was held
on March 14, 2025. Foster Care Worker didn't sign it until
April 8th, so Youth A is currently being evaluated within the
30-school day timeline. His eligibility IEP will be held on or
before May 21st.
• Facility education policy: Educational services will be
provided by in-house certified teachers and will meet
current Michigan Standards. All youths will be enrolled in
an education program no later than five days after
admission. These services will include basic remediation
and specialized work in reading, speech, and other areas.
Youths will receive an individualized education plan after an
appropriate education assessment is made through
educational testing and counseling.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance per staff and youth interviews
and documentation reviewed, the facility has a school onsite and
is providing adequate education to meet the needs of the youths.
4

Technical Assistance:
• Technical assistance was provided regarding the lack of
communication between the school administrator and case
manager to ensure youths IEPs are completed on time.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
